description: tbdMicrosoft's OneNote is the helpful note taking application in the Office suite to keep you organized for any project. Whether is it for working on a large project with co-workers to tracking recipes for dinner, OneNote is a great answer for keeping everything in one place. In this series, you will learn how to create and organize notebooks, add different types of content and stay on task with tags, use helpful features such as Linked Notes and the OneNote Web Clipper, share notebooks with others, and how OneNote interacts with other Office applications.   The series specifically covers the OneNote 2016 application in the locally installed Office suite for the Windows operating system.
descriptionMD: Microsoft's OneNote is the helpful note taking application in the Office suite to keep you organized for any project. Whether is it for working on a large project with co-workers to tracking recipes for dinner, OneNote is a great answer for keeping everything in one place. In this series, you will learn how to create and organize notebooks, add different types of content and stay on task with tags, use helpful features such as Linked Notes and the OneNote Web Clipper, share notebooks with others, and how OneNote interacts with other Office applications.   The series specifically covers the OneNote 2016 application in the locally installed Office suite for the Windows operating system.
name: OneNote 2016 for Windows
subtitle: OneNote

episodes.description: Microsoft's OneNote is the helpful note taking application in the Office suite to keep you organized for any project. Whether is it for working on a large project with co-workers to tracking recipes for dinner, OneNote is a great answer for keeping everything in one place. In this series, you will learn how to create and organize notebooks, add different types of content and stay on task with tags, use helpful features such as Linked Notes and the OneNote Web Clipper, share notebooks with others, and how OneNote interacts with other Office applications.   The series specifically covers the OneNote 2016 application in the locally installed Office suite for the Windows operating system.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.792
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.792 --> 00:00:10.150
Hello everyone, and
welcome to OneNote 2016 for Windows.

3
00:00:10.150 --> 00:00:11.700
I'm your host Vonne Smith.

4
00:00:11.700 --> 00:00:15.300
In this course overview,
we are going to be discussing,

5
00:00:15.300 --> 00:00:18.120
well, what is this whole show about?

6
00:00:18.120 --> 00:00:21.820
Who should be watching this show,
what is our target audience?

7
00:00:21.820 --> 00:00:23.980
What should I know before
we get started and

8
00:00:23.980 --> 00:00:26.840
any extra tidbits that you might have for
me.

9
00:00:26.840 --> 00:00:28.990
So let's talk about the topics.

10
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:30.650
Well, this is one show.

11
00:00:30.650 --> 00:00:32.770
There is not any different levels, okay?

12
00:00:32.770 --> 00:00:34.700
So ti's just OneNote 2016.

13
00:00:34.700 --> 00:00:37.210
We cover everything from
the very beginning.

14
00:00:37.210 --> 00:00:39.230
We start with well, what is OneNote?

15
00:00:40.320 --> 00:00:46.130
And what's the difference between
OneNote 2016 and OneNote for Windows 10.

16
00:00:46.130 --> 00:00:46.890
Yeah.

17
00:00:46.890 --> 00:00:50.290
Same product or named the same but
two different products.

18
00:00:50.290 --> 00:00:51.470
So we clarify that and

19
00:00:51.470 --> 00:00:56.220
get you started with exactly what
this whole product can do for you.

20
00:00:56.220 --> 00:01:01.860
Then we talk about the file structures,
like what is the .one file and

21
00:01:01.860 --> 00:01:07.500
how and what happens when we first install
this product onto our machines and

22
00:01:07.500 --> 00:01:11.170
some of those default installation
features that happen.

23
00:01:11.170 --> 00:01:16.000
We explore the interface and
how to navigate within the product and

24
00:01:16.000 --> 00:01:18.380
also navigating within notebooks.

25
00:01:18.380 --> 00:01:21.290
Because in OneNote we
are creating notebooks, just

26
00:01:21.290 --> 00:01:25.770
like in Excel we're creating workbooks,
and I tend to mix those up sometimes so

27
00:01:25.770 --> 00:01:29.670
you might hear me refer to them as
workbooks throughout these episodes.

28
00:01:29.670 --> 00:01:33.710
We're then going to create our first
Notebook with sections and pages.

29
00:01:33.710 --> 00:01:38.930
And then we have a whole section or
whole episode on note worthy options,

30
00:01:38.930 --> 00:01:43.540
going over the different options
within the program that we will

31
00:01:43.540 --> 00:01:48.410
cover in future episodes in
the adding content section but

32
00:01:48.410 --> 00:01:52.460
just to kind of give you a nice
overview of all of them in one place.

33
00:01:52.460 --> 00:01:54.350
Like I said,
then we get on to adding content.

34
00:01:54.350 --> 00:02:00.090
We're gonna be adding in text, images,
tables, drawings, audio and video.

35
00:02:00.090 --> 00:02:04.370
We'll also talk about the Web Clipper and
how we can actually copy content from

36
00:02:04.370 --> 00:02:07.600
the internet because that's usually
a lot of places where we're going to be

37
00:02:07.600 --> 00:02:11.060
finding and researching information
about our different projects and

38
00:02:11.060 --> 00:02:13.670
putting them into our digital notebooks.

39
00:02:13.670 --> 00:02:16.650
We'll talk about what is a quick note,
where do they go?

40
00:02:16.650 --> 00:02:18.460
Why do I wanna use them?

41
00:02:18.460 --> 00:02:22.060
What about linked notes,
something specific in One Note 2016.

42
00:02:22.060 --> 00:02:27.430
And then how do I handle attachments and
then adding them as printouts?

43
00:02:27.430 --> 00:02:28.680
And what about links?

44
00:02:28.680 --> 00:02:32.180
Not just our regular web links
that we think about with URLs, but

45
00:02:32.180 --> 00:02:37.240
internal links that we can actually
use as navigation within a notebook.

46
00:02:37.240 --> 00:02:41.750
Then we move on to organizing and
managing our content.

47
00:02:41.750 --> 00:02:42.710
So organize and manage.

48
00:02:42.710 --> 00:02:49.320
Talking about tags, what are those and how
they can help us organize our information.

49
00:02:49.320 --> 00:02:53.690
I need to tag something as a to do list or
I need to tag something as important.

50
00:02:53.690 --> 00:02:58.270
Then I can go and find those tags and
really help me keep organized and

51
00:02:58.270 --> 00:02:59.660
manage my content.

52
00:02:59.660 --> 00:03:04.120
We'll also talk about the powerful search
feature within OneNote, whether you're

53
00:03:04.120 --> 00:03:09.210
searching a page, a section, a notebook,
or all of your notebooks that you have.

54
00:03:09.210 --> 00:03:14.330
We'll also manage sections and
pages, copying or moving.

55
00:03:14.330 --> 00:03:18.840
Different ways that we can
merge our sections together.

56
00:03:18.840 --> 00:03:21.120
We then move on to proofing and

57
00:03:21.120 --> 00:03:25.080
review, things that are across most of
our office programs like spellcheck.

58
00:03:25.080 --> 00:03:28.800
But there's a couple of other things
specific in OneNote that we will go over.

59
00:03:28.800 --> 00:03:33.530
And then we talk about printing our
OneNote notebooks and then exporting

60
00:03:33.530 --> 00:03:38.070
them out to other options such as a PDF,
or what is a OneNote package.

61
00:03:39.860 --> 00:03:40.670
Collaboration and

62
00:03:40.670 --> 00:03:45.290
security, that something that is really
big within all of our office providers.

63
00:03:45.290 --> 00:03:49.300
How we can collaborate in
real time with other people.

64
00:03:49.300 --> 00:03:53.160
When we're researching or
doing a project within an organization,

65
00:03:53.160 --> 00:03:55.160
lots of time you're
working with other people.

66
00:03:55.160 --> 00:03:58.120
So how do we share a notebook?

67
00:03:58.120 --> 00:04:03.030
How do we integrate this with our
Outlook and our Skype applications,

68
00:04:03.030 --> 00:04:07.960
our other Office applications, to be able
to collaborate with other people, or

69
00:04:07.960 --> 00:04:10.750
just really how I can
just be more efficient

70
00:04:10.750 --> 00:04:15.010
with sharing information with
the integration in Outlook?

71
00:04:15.010 --> 00:04:18.220
We actually have two parts in
that particular episode, and

72
00:04:18.220 --> 00:04:19.800
then password security.

73
00:04:19.800 --> 00:04:23.970
How can I secure certain parts
of my notebooks, because

74
00:04:23.970 --> 00:04:27.305
I've shared out a notebook with you, but
I don't want you to see this one section.

75
00:04:27.305 --> 00:04:30.395
So we will learn how to
password protect a section.

76
00:04:30.395 --> 00:04:34.090
That's the only place you can do
is the section, not on your pages.

77
00:04:35.350 --> 00:04:38.600
Now we take a look at OneNote
on other platforms, so

78
00:04:38.600 --> 00:04:44.390
I will show you how OneNote looks and
behaves on an iPad,

79
00:04:44.390 --> 00:04:49.050
an iPhone, we do online,
so we do OneNote online.

80
00:04:49.050 --> 00:04:53.150
I also review it on a Macintosh
operating system, and

81
00:04:53.150 --> 00:04:58.200
also giving you a quick overview of it
on a Windows 10 operating system and

82
00:04:58.200 --> 00:05:01.260
we even threw in an Android
episode on there.

83
00:05:01.260 --> 00:05:04.290
So just a nice review
of what is it gonna do,

84
00:05:04.290 --> 00:05:08.670
not a very in-depth part of how to
use it strictly for the iPhone but

85
00:05:08.670 --> 00:05:15.310
at least it'll get you stated in how it
compares and contrasts from the desktop

86
00:05:15.310 --> 00:05:20.620
local installation of OneNote 2016,
but those are our topics.

87
00:05:20.620 --> 00:05:22.820
So who should be watching this show?

88
00:05:22.820 --> 00:05:24.970
Anybody that wants to
learn all about OneNote.

89
00:05:24.970 --> 00:05:27.510
We start from the very beginning and
then we go all the way through it.

90
00:05:27.510 --> 00:05:29.690
So I would say any Office user,

91
00:05:29.690 --> 00:05:34.470
whether you're in Office 365 or in you
could just say an office in general.

92
00:05:34.470 --> 00:05:37.300
Maybe your office is just your house.

93
00:05:37.300 --> 00:05:37.900
That's fine too.

94
00:05:37.900 --> 00:05:41.740
And this is specifically for
Windows users.

95
00:05:41.740 --> 00:05:46.230
If you're on a Macintosh platform
you could get the gist of it, but

96
00:05:46.230 --> 00:05:52.130
they are decently different between
Windows and Mac and other platforms,

97
00:05:52.130 --> 00:05:56.890
and even Windows 10 version of OneNote,
which we cover in there.

98
00:05:56.890 --> 00:06:00.890
So I would say, anybody who wants to
learn the basics to an intermediate usage

99
00:06:00.890 --> 00:06:03.460
of OneNote, this is the show for you.

100
00:06:03.460 --> 00:06:06.280
What do you need to know about?

101
00:06:06.280 --> 00:06:09.720
Just some Windows basics,
do you know where the Start menu is?

102
00:06:09.720 --> 00:06:14.800
Do you know what the notification area is,
and if you don't I show you.

103
00:06:14.800 --> 00:06:17.910
So just some basic
information to get started,

104
00:06:17.910 --> 00:06:20.920
you do not have to have any
prior knowledge of this product.

105
00:06:20.920 --> 00:06:23.260
It is from the very, very beginning,

106
00:06:23.260 --> 00:06:27.920
all the way through the advanced
features of OneNote.

107
00:06:27.920 --> 00:06:29.840
OneNote's only so deep.

108
00:06:29.840 --> 00:06:35.650
It's not like say, Word, or Excel that
we have three different levels in Word,

109
00:06:35.650 --> 00:06:38.060
we had essentials, advanced and expert.

110
00:06:38.060 --> 00:06:43.160
For this,
there's only one series because just that.

111
00:06:43.160 --> 00:06:44.600
Okay?
It's nice, it's a great product,

112
00:06:44.600 --> 00:06:46.270
I really like this one.

113
00:06:46.270 --> 00:06:51.760
And then any other information or
knowledge you have about using Outlook or

114
00:06:51.760 --> 00:06:56.450
using Word, this will all help because
a lot of your office products are similar

115
00:06:56.450 --> 00:06:59.230
in nature, like the interface with
the ribbon and things like that.

116
00:06:59.230 --> 00:07:02.930
So, that will definitely help you,
but it is not required.

117
00:07:04.490 --> 00:07:05.590
Exercise files and notes.

118
00:07:05.590 --> 00:07:10.620
Now, this is something that, for my shows,
I usually have exercise files for

119
00:07:10.620 --> 00:07:13.730
you to follow along like,
if you've watched the Word series.

120
00:07:13.730 --> 00:07:17.930
There is usually a file for
every specific episode,

121
00:07:17.930 --> 00:07:20.010
and then you follow along with that.

122
00:07:21.270 --> 00:07:23.106
This show's a little bit different, okay?

123
00:07:23.106 --> 00:07:26.690
There are episode notes, so all the notes
that I say hey, refer to that for

124
00:07:26.690 --> 00:07:29.820
the link, you have that for
each individual ones, and

125
00:07:29.820 --> 00:07:32.400
they're all wrapped up in
this particular overview.

126
00:07:32.400 --> 00:07:35.800
But I don't have individual files for
each episode.

127
00:07:36.910 --> 00:07:39.620
What I suggest is following along,
create your own,

128
00:07:39.620 --> 00:07:43.000
and when I'm making a new notebook,
you make your own notebook.

129
00:07:43.000 --> 00:07:45.100
When I add a picture, you add a picture.

130
00:07:45.100 --> 00:07:49.590
So everything that I'm doing,
you're more than welcome to follow along

131
00:07:49.590 --> 00:07:53.820
as you create your own pages and sections
and your content and everything like that.

132
00:07:53.820 --> 00:07:59.830
So there's nothing that I really have
ready for you and it is a continuous, it's

133
00:07:59.830 --> 00:08:06.212
continuously building on each episode as
we go through to make a very large [LAUGH]

134
00:08:06.212 --> 00:08:11.600
kind of disjointed notebook because I'm
just using it as demonstration purposes.

135
00:08:11.600 --> 00:08:16.210
But I figure you might want
the finished notebooks that I did for

136
00:08:16.210 --> 00:08:17.390
this particular series.

137
00:08:17.390 --> 00:08:21.260
And I have a lot of pictures of cats and
a lot of information about cats.

138
00:08:21.260 --> 00:08:23.730
But, you're more than
welcome to take that,

139
00:08:23.730 --> 00:08:27.630
open that particular OneNote notebook and
page through it,

140
00:08:27.630 --> 00:08:32.900
and thumb through it, and be able to
mix and match it all on your own.

141
00:08:32.900 --> 00:08:35.270
It might not make any sense, like I said,

142
00:08:35.270 --> 00:08:38.390
because I do a lot of practice
within that notebook.

143
00:08:38.390 --> 00:08:42.650
So I would not take the finished
notebook that's in this overview

144
00:08:43.680 --> 00:08:46.970
as a study guide for
this particular product.

145
00:08:46.970 --> 00:08:49.090
And you'll see as we go
through the episode,

146
00:08:49.090 --> 00:08:54.160
you'll, the finished file, you'll see
the end result of those episodes.

147
00:08:54.160 --> 00:08:55.080
But I figured, why not?

148
00:08:55.080 --> 00:08:56.490
Go ahead.

149
00:08:56.490 --> 00:08:58.514
Have a notebook with lots of cats.

150
00:08:58.514 --> 00:09:03.490
[LAUGH] And anything extra that we need to
know about, there are always more options

151
00:09:03.490 --> 00:09:06.950
in all of our Microsoft products,
really any product, that is.

152
00:09:06.950 --> 00:09:09.560
I might show you the three
different ways to do it, but

153
00:09:09.560 --> 00:09:12.080
there's like a fourth and a fifth way.

154
00:09:12.080 --> 00:09:14.560
I might not cover every
single one of them.

155
00:09:14.560 --> 00:09:19.390
So definitely check it out and find other
options on your own like searching for

156
00:09:19.390 --> 00:09:20.060
the answers.

157
00:09:20.060 --> 00:09:22.665
You know there's a total pool of,

158
00:09:22.665 --> 00:09:25.680
a plethora of information
out there on the Internet.

159
00:09:25.680 --> 00:09:27.440
So do a search, find out.

160
00:09:27.440 --> 00:09:29.630
If something is not working,
search for it.

161
00:09:29.630 --> 00:09:32.240
I do that.
In a lot of these episodes I try to cover

162
00:09:32.240 --> 00:09:36.640
those things that I had a question about
it, so I try to answer it for you.

163
00:09:36.640 --> 00:09:39.930
But I'm sure there's many,
many more because everybody has

164
00:09:39.930 --> 00:09:43.198
a different reason of why
they use every product.

165
00:09:43.198 --> 00:09:46.630
OneNote is very personalized.

166
00:09:46.630 --> 00:09:52.170
You're going to organize your information
and take notes the way the you understand,

167
00:09:52.170 --> 00:09:56.040
and the way that I do things might not
be the same way that you do things.

168
00:09:56.040 --> 00:09:58.930
So this is a very individualized product.

169
00:10:00.040 --> 00:10:01.460
So keep that in mind and just,

170
00:10:01.460 --> 00:10:06.630
one way that somebody uses a notebook is
not necessarily the way that you do it.

171
00:10:06.630 --> 00:10:08.250
That's okay, to each his own.

172
00:10:08.250 --> 00:10:11.330
It's all good, because we should
be just having fun with this.

173
00:10:11.330 --> 00:10:15.650
That's the whole reason why we're here,
is to make learning fun.

174
00:10:15.650 --> 00:10:18.000
Now if you're like but
you didn't say anything about updates, and

175
00:10:18.000 --> 00:10:21.200
you have in big letters normally.

176
00:10:21.200 --> 00:10:25.730
Well, normally I'd tell you that your
Office products always have updates and

177
00:10:25.730 --> 00:10:29.150
it's always changing, so
if there's changes that's fine.

178
00:10:29.150 --> 00:10:31.440
Well this product is slightly different,
and

179
00:10:31.440 --> 00:10:35.270
you'll see why as we go into more in
depth in our introduction episode.

180
00:10:35.270 --> 00:10:40.390
But they're not going to be updating
with new features for this particular

181
00:10:40.390 --> 00:10:45.330
product because of them migrating
over to another version of one node.

182
00:10:45.330 --> 00:10:47.520
Like hmm, that sounds interesting.

183
00:10:47.520 --> 00:10:48.740
What are you talking about?

184
00:10:48.740 --> 00:10:51.960
Well, what you'll have
to do is stay tuned and

185
00:10:51.960 --> 00:10:56.155
go ahead and see our introduction episode,
and I will see you real soon.

186
00:10:56.155 --> 00:11:02.230
>> [NOISE]

episodes.description: Vonne and Wes kick off the OneNote 2016 for Windows series with an introduction to the application. They discuss the difference between OneNote 2016 for Windows and OneNote for Windows 10 as well as OneDrive for Business vs OneDrive for Windows 10.  They also explain the "rumor" that OneNote 2016 is being cancelled by Microsoft.
episodes.title: Introduction to OneNote 2016

episodes.description: OneNote 2016 is an easy to use application, but it is important to understand the basics and default settings. Vonne and Wes discuss and demonstrate what happens when you first install OneNote 2016, when you first launch OneNote 2016, and overall default settings for notebook creation.
episodes.title: Understanding OneNote Files

episodes.description: While it sounds simple, opening and closing files in OneNote 2016 is an important first step to using the application. Here, Vonne and Wes discuss opening and closing local and cloud stored notebooks, notebook properties and settings, and common warnings and issues with notebook syncing.
episodes.title: Open and Close Notebooks

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne explore the OneNote 2016 environment and how to navigate in a notebook. They cover notebook structure, page views and zoom, and customization options.
episodes.title: OneNote Interface and Notebook Navigation

episodes.description: Vonne and Wes discuss how to create a new notebook in OneNote 2016. They demonstrate the steps to create a notebook that is stored locally as well as in OneDrive. They also show how to create and manage sections and section groups.
episodes.title: Create a Notebook

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Vonne show how to create new pages in a notebook. They discuss adding and formatting page titles, formatting pages, managing pages, and page templates.
episodes.title: Create Pages and Templates

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri take a detailed look at OneNote Options. They explain and demonstrate some noteworthy options for display, screen clippings, send to OneNote, drawing, and a variety of other items in OneNote 2016.
episodes.title: Noteworth OneNote Options

episodes.description: Aubri and Vonne start adding content to pages, specifically text and tables. They show how to add, select, move, resize, format, and manage text and table containers on a page.
episodes.title: Text and Tables

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri show how to add images to notebook pages. They discuss the limited formatting options available (as compared to other Office products), searchable text in images, and setting image as background.
episodes.title: Images

episodes.description: Where does everyone go to research anything? The internet of course! In this episode, Vonne and Aubri take a look at copying information from the web to add a OneNote notebook as well as the OneNote Web Clipper.
episodes.title: Copy from Web to Web Clipper

episodes.description: A picture is worth a thousand words. Aubri and Vonne demonstrate how to use drawing tools and shapes. They cover pen modes, format drawn content, ink to text, and ink to math.
episodes.title: Draw Content

episodes.description: Quick Notes are just like those little notepads and scratch pieces of paper you use to jot down something. In this episode, Vonne and Aubri discuss what are Quick Notes and how to manage them to your advantage.
episodes.title: Quick Notes

episodes.description: When taking notes or researching, it's always great to remember what file or web page you were looking at when you wrote something down.  Linked Notes does just that in OneNote. Vonne and Aubri demonstrate this neat feature in this episode.
episodes.title: Linked Notes

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri discuss links in OneNote 2016. They demonstrate how to create links from the Copy Link to and the Link options in the right click menu.
episodes.title: Links

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Vonne demonstrate how to attach files and insert file printouts to pages. They emphasize these attachments are not links to original source files, but embedded copies.
episodes.title: Attachments and Printouts

episodes.description: Sometimes it is easier to record a quick video than write out a long note. In this episode, Vonne and Aubri demonstrate how to insert audio and video in a OneNote notebook.
episodes.title: Audio and Video

episodes.description: Tagging content is a great way to stay organized. In this episode, Vonne and Aubri show how to use tags, search for tags, create custom tags, and generate a summary page of tagged elements.
episodes.title: Tags

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri demonstrate OneNote's powerful search capabilities. They search for text and phrases in pages, images, handwriting, and even video and audio clips.
episodes.title: Search

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri discuss ways to organize and manage content in a notebook. They review topics from other episodes such as creating section groups, moving and copying pages and sections, merging sections, creating subpages, marking content as read and unread, and the notebook recycle bin.
episodes.title: Organize and Manage

episodes.description: Backup, backup, backup. In this episode, Vonne and Aubri look at History tab and review the different commands. They demonstrate how to use version control on pages, find recent edits, find by author for shared notebooks, mark pages as read and unread, and the notebook recycle bin. They also discuss OneNote's backup system and how to make a backup by exporting.
episodes.title: History and Backups

episodes.description: Aubri and Vonne discuss items on the Review tab and the importance of proofing notebook content. They demonstrate how to spell check, look up content with the research resources, find synonyms with the thesaurus, and translate content into different languages. They also review basic concepts of accessibility and the accessibility checker.
episodes.title: Proof and Review

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri review printing and exporting options.  They show how to export pages, sections, and notebooks into different file formats such as  OneNote section files (.one), Word documents (.docx), PDFs (.pdf) and OneNote package files (.onepkg).
episodes.title: Print and Export

episodes.description: Sharing is caring. In this episode, Vonne and Aubri show how to share notebooks with others. They show how to share a notebook as an owner as well as how accept and access a share request as a recipient. They also show how to manage permissions to notebook files in OneDrive.
episodes.title: Share Notebooks

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri demonstrate how OneNote and Outlook work together to keep user's organized and on task.  In this episode, they show how to email notebook pages as well as how to send emails to a notebook. They also show how to sync tasks in Outlook with OneNote.
episodes.title: OneNote with Outlook

episodes.description: Aubri and Vonne continue to show OneNote and Outlook working together. They cover how to work with notebooks in conjunction with meetings in Outlook. They show how to take personal notes for a meeting as well as taking notes with meeting participants in a shared notebook.
episodes.title: OneNote with Outlook Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri talk about how OneNote notebooks work with Skype for Business. They show how to take notes in an online meeting or conversation as well as sharing notes with other participants. They also show some actions that can make it a little more confusing and ow to avoid them.
episodes.title: OneNote with Skype for Business

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Vonne show how to password protect sections in a notebook.
episodes.title: Password Protect

episodes.description: Aubri and Vonne explore and review OneNote on different platforms.  In this episode, they show OneNote for Windows 10 and explore some of the differences between it and OneNote 2016.
episodes.title: OneNote for Windows 10

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri show OneNote Online. They review the differences between using OneNote in a browser vs the desktop version.
episodes.title: OneNote Online

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Aubri demonstrate using OneNote for Mac.
episodes.title: OneNote for Mac

episodes.description: Vonne and Aubri bring out the iPad Pro and the iPencil to show how to use OneNote for iPad.
episodes.title: OneNote for iPad

episodes.description: Aubri and Vonne explore how to use OneNote on an iPhone.
episodes.title: OneNote for iPhone

episodes.description: In this episode, Aubri and Vonne show how OneNote works on an Android phone.
episodes.title: OneNote for Android
